href="/trent-ltd/stocks/companyid-13456.cms" data-ga-onclick="Inarticle articleshow link click#Markets#href" target="_blank">Trent Ltd</a>. slipped 1.45 per cent to Rs 1308.6 in Tuesday's trade as of 12:09PM (<a href="/ist-ltd/stocks/companyid-11957.cms" data-ga-onclick="Inarticle articleshow link click#Markets#href" target="_blank">IST</a>). The stock hit a high price of Rs 1336.5 and low of Rs 1306.95 during the session. <br> <br> The return on equity (ROE) for the stock stood at 4.47 per cent. Traded volume on the counter stood at 12:09PM shares and turnover at Rs 0.62 crore around that time. The stock of <a data-ga-onclick="Inarticle articleshow link click#Markets#href" href="/topic/trent" target="_blank">Trent</a> Ltd. quoted a 52-week high price of Rs 1571.0 and 52-week low prices of Rs 983.7, respectively. <br><div data-url="/articleshow_stocks_widget.cms?companies=13456,11957" id="stockDataWidget"></div> <br> The stock's Beta value, which measures its volatility in relation to the broader market, stood at 0.62. <br> <br> <b>Promotor/FII Holding</b> <br> Promoters held 37.01 per cent stake in the company as of 31-Dec-2022, while overseas investors held 24.76 per cent and domestic institutional investors had 9.47 per cent. <br> <br> <b>Key Financials </b> <br> The company reported consolidated sales of Rs 2365.24 crore for the quarter ended 31-Dec-2022, up 16.94 per cent from previous quarter's Rs 2022.66 crore and up 54.6 per cent from the year-ago quarter's Rs 1529.95 crore. Net profit after tax for the latest quarter stood at Rs 167.0 crore, up 19.55 per cent from the same quarter a year ago. <br><div class="adBox custom_ad mgid" data-mgid="mgid_99054491"><div class="colombia colombiaAd" data-section="0" data-position="99054491" data-slot="491591" data-msg="ctnCallbackHandler" id="div-clmb-ctn-208630-99054491"></div></div> <br><div data-size="[[300, 250], [600, 250], [600, 300]]" data-adsSlot="/7176/Economictimes/ET_News/ET_News_ROS/ET_News_ROS_MID_INTL_300" data-loc="100" id="div-gpt-ad-858478126-1-99054491" class="country_specAD"></div> <b>Technicals<br></b> The MACD signalled a bearish bias on the counter. The MACD is known for signalling trend reversals in traded securities or indices. <br> It is the difference between the 26-day and 12-day exponential moving averages. A nine-day exponential moving average, called the signal line, is plotted on topof the MACD to reflect "buy" or "sell" opportunities. When the MACD crosses below the signal line, it gives a bearish signal, indicating that the price of the security may see a downward movement and vice versa.</div><p style="display:none;" class="footnote-slot showWhatsMsg">Don’t miss out on ET Prime stories! 			  "articleSection" : "Markets",
			  "articleBody":"Shares of Trent Ltd. slipped 1.45 per cent to Rs 1308.6 in Tuesday's trade as of 12:09PM (IST). The stock hit a high price of Rs 1336.5 and low of Rs 1306.95 during the session.   The return on equity (ROE) for the stock stood at 4.47 per cent. Traded volume on the counter stood at 12:09PM shares and turnover at Rs 0.62 crore around that time. The stock of Trent Ltd. quoted a 52-week high price of Rs 1571.0 and 52-week low prices of Rs 983.7, respectively.   The stock's Beta value, which measures its volatility in relation to the broader market, stood at 0.62.   Promotor/FII Holding  Promoters held 37.01 per cent stake in the company as of 31-Dec-2022, while overseas investors held 24.76 per cent and domestic institutional investors had 9.47 per cent.   Key Financials   The company reported consolidated sales of Rs 2365.24 crore for the quarter ended 31-Dec-2022, up 16.94 per cent from previous quarter's Rs 2022.66 crore and up 54.6 per cent from the year-ago quarter's Rs 1529.95 crore. Net profit after tax for the latest quarter stood at Rs 167.0 crore, up 19.55 per cent from the same quarter a year ago.   Technicals The MACD signalled a bearish bias on the counter. The MACD is known for signalling trend reversals in traded securities or indices.  It is the difference between the 26-day and 12-day exponential moving averages. A nine-day exponential moving average, called the signal line, is plotted on topof the MACD to reflect  buy  or  sell  opportunities. When the MACD crosses below the signal line, it gives a bearish signal, indicating that the price of the security may see a downward movement and vice versa.",

main.headline: Share price of Trent  falls  as Nifty  weakens
main.description: A total of 4,672 shares changed hands on the counter till 12:09PM (IST).
main.articleBody: Shares of Trent Ltd. slipped 1.45 per cent to Rs 1308.6 in Tuesday's trade as of 12:09PM (IST). The stock hit a high price of Rs 1336.5 and low of Rs 1306.95 during the session.   The return on equity (ROE) for the stock stood at 4.47 per cent. Traded volume on the counter stood at 12:09PM shares and turnover at Rs 0.62 crore around that time. The stock of Trent Ltd. quoted a 52-week high price of Rs 1571.0 and 52-week low prices of Rs 983.7, respectively.   The stock's Beta value, which measures its volatility in relation to the broader market, stood at 0.62.   Promotor/FII Holding  Promoters held 37.01 per cent stake in the company as of 31-Dec-2022, while overseas investors held 24.76 per cent and domestic institutional investors had 9.47 per cent.   Key Financials   The company reported consolidated sales of Rs 2365.24 crore for the quarter ended 31-Dec-2022, up 16.94 per cent from previous quarter's Rs 2022.66 crore and up 54.6 per cent from the year-ago quarter's Rs 1529.95 crore. Net profit after tax for the latest quarter stood at Rs 167.0 crore, up 19.55 per cent from the same quarter a year ago.   Technicals The MACD signalled a bearish bias on the counter. The MACD is known for signalling trend reversals in traded securities or indices.  It is the difference between the 26-day and 12-day exponential moving averages. A nine-day exponential moving average, called the signal line, is plotted on topof the MACD to reflect  buy  or  sell  opportunities. When the MACD crosses below the signal line, it gives a bearish signal, indicating that the price of the security may see a downward movement and vice versa.
